course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Late Imperial China from Yuan to Qing
course.description: This course will cover the history of China from the Yuan to the Qing dynasties. It will introduce students to the political, social, economic, and cultural changes that took place during this period, and also places China firmly in context of world history. Students will engage both primary and secondary sources and are encouraged to ask pertinent questions with regards to how changes and continuities took place. The course will also look beyond the strict temporal confines of the late imperial period and examine how history has informed the contours of China today.

reviews.author: HonestReview01
reviews.title: Decent course for whose who are interested in studying Chinese History
reviews.comment_content:
Midterm(Exam):
1.The Dragon; The Scale
2.The Nine Sloughs; Kan and Emperor
3.Economy and Ecology; Families
4.The Business of Things (Cancelled); The South China Sea
5.The collapse of a dynasty and the rise of another
6.The rise and splendor of the Qing Dynasty; The Decline of the Qing Dynasty
=====================
Special topic: Smuggling in the 1500s and the Rise and Fall of Macau (Not included in Midterm Exam)
=====================
Final(Essay):
1.The Canton System and the Opium War
2.The Taiping Rebellion and the Foreigners(Not included in Midterm Exam)
3.Reform and Revolution(Not included in Midterm Exam)

The first half of this course focuses more on Economical and Social aspects about the Yuan and Ming Dynasty which is not familiar for most of us while the second part of this course consists of general history about the Qing Dynasty.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching was decent, but you may feel tiring since it began at 9 a.m.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm examination: 20 %
Final Essay:         50 %
Assignment: 10 %
Tutorial Presentation:   10 %
Tutorial Participation: 10 %

Everyone got full mark in tutorial due to the situation in Hong Kong and I got a full mark on both assignment and midterm exam. The score for the final essay was hidden and overall I got a B+, probably my performance for the essay was not that good when comparing to the others.
reviews.comment_workload: Originally the workload for this course should be a 'D' as you have to prepare for the tutorial presentation and finish the assignment, as well as memorizing a heavy amount of content for the 2 exams. However, due to the social and political situation in Hong Kong, the original grading scheme and content were basically ruined, the final exam was replaced by an essay. As a result, the overall workload became slightly lower.

reviews.author: ECream
reviews.title: Nice content but boring
reviews.comment_content:
Check other comments for the main topics.

More specifically, it's more like an economic/commercial history of China from Ming to late Qing, I don't think there's that much discussions on aspects such as politics and culture. As someone who is interested in economics, I guess it's pretty cool to look at history in this way. I don't think the topics are that disorganized as others commented, as each topics are interconnected in my opinion.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Throughout the semester, I have read quite some papers written by Prof Lee, he is definitely an expertise in modern Chinese history research. Yet he has a great room for improvement as a lecturer. His teaching is lack of enthusiasm, which he just read the ppt word by word, and his attempts of student interactions were minimal. I wonder if it was because of his attitude, or it was just his unproficiency in English that limited his teaching.

To be fair, if a student read the readings in advance of the lecture, his lecture might not be as boring, or more questions could be raised from the student to start some meaningful discussions. Nevertheless, each reading are at least 20 pages long, and difficult to read for non History students, I don't think anyone would actually have the time to read the readings each week.
reviews.comment_grading:
- Slightly below mean in midterm
- Probably didn't do that well in project (One potential freerider, and some groupmates were simply too busy to deliver quality work)
- Above mean in final exam

Got B, as average as possible, I think this course is actually competitive, as the highest and minimum score differences were low according to Prof.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's reasonable in my opinion, maybe a B+

A midterm, a final exam, and a project. No weekly homework, that's it.

But in every lecture, you better screenshot Prof Lee's ppt, as he would not share it on Canvas.

Readings are useful and essential for better grades imo, but you don't have to read every single word on the reading, just skim through it until you feel that you've come across something important. So I completed a half semester worth of readings within 2 days for my final exam study.

The project is not that great of a deal, unless there's a freerider in your group.

reviews.comment_workload:
This course so "hea", only one lesson per week, and the lesson only last for 1 to 1.5 hour. Only 8 lessons in total.

reviews.author: 油尖旺筋肉人
reviews.title: Great Instructor with generous grade
reviews.comment_content:
A bit disorganised as the syllabus is not dynasty-centric, but topic-centric.
Let's say the lecture is about governance. The prof will talk and refer back and forth in between dynasties instead of focusing one dynasty for one teaching session.
A good thing though is that the course offers unique perspectives to Chinese history, like the occurrence of dragons and its association with the legitimacy of the emperor, for example.
reviews.comment_teaching:
It's ok.
The TA and the prof are very open to questions regarding the course arrangements, especially the assignments.
reviews.comment_grading:
Generous.
I screwed up my midterm but still secure an A.
And amidst the suspension of classes, the prof gave all10/10 for tutorial participation.
